list_definition.definition: a woman’s (often loose) garment for the upper half of the body

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She was wearing a skirt and blouse.

list_ex_of_english: This is a somewhat fuzzy date in that photographs in 1923 show a loose standard dress of dark skirt and white blouse.
Actually, there seems to have been resistance to wearing modern blouses among women, who often wore it under compulsion.
Sometimes they are also used in puns, as with the article entitled top secret, in which blouses, t-shirts and tops in general are features.
Sweaters or blouses, dresses or dress pants, the clothing and the deportment of the performers in these studio-controlled snapshots universally attest to the respectability of the performer herself.
New clothes are bought rarely; children's clothes and women's blouses are stitched at home.
In this reckoning, one may see how wearing the blouse is thus 'sanitised'.
I wouldn't wear the blouse during day-time.
B is tempted to walk out; after all, she has plenty of other blouses.
